studyMetadata.title: Drawing example
studyMetadata.description: A simple demo of using stimuli in an HTML file that renders a D3 visualization. Data is collected via a numeric response field.

response.prompt: Do you consent to the study and wish to continue?

drawingTraining.description: Question that asks users to count the number of bars that have a value greater than 1.
drawingTraining.instruction:
To the right, there is a drawing interface with a few options. In the header, you can change between a pencil and an eraser, change the size of your pencil, and change the color of your pencil. Below the options is a blank canvas for you to draw on.
Feel free to practice using the drawing interface now, and when you feel comfortable, click the next button to begin the drawing tasks.

drawingNetwork.description: Question that asks users to count the number of bars that have a value greater than 1.
drawingNetwork.instruction:
Below is a list of authors, how many papers each author has published, and how many papers author pairs have published together.
![demo](assets/drawingTasks/networkTask.png)
Sketch a visualization which shows each author and their paper counts, as well as the collabortion and collaboration counts between authors.
While doing so, please talk aloud to explain your thought process or any challenges you face.

response.prompt: Have you finished drawing your visualization?
